cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 240 miles SSE of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: continuing northwest across the central Gulf toward the southeast Louisiana coast, then turning north and northeast inland over Louisiana and Mississippi
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana coast near Houma/Grand Isle (between Intracoastal City and the Mouth of the Pearl River)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect west of Cameron LA
weather_observation.warning_coast: Cameron LA to west of Intracoastal City LA under Tropical Storm Warning
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Intracoastal City LA eastward to the AL/FL border (highest impacts near southeast LA and MS coasts)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm–force winds (40–50 mph) are probable late Sunday into early Monday with a low (≈10%) chance of reaching 50-kt sustained.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–3 ft possible along the Cameron/Sabine Pass coast; significant surge impacts focus east of the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain possible Sunday–Monday with localized flooding of low-lying terminal and access roads.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornado threat, rough seas in the Calcasieu Ship Channel, potential for short-term power outages affecting cargo handling.
